etymologies: 1930s: from disc+ -graphy, on the pattern of biography

definitions: a descriptive catalog of musical recordings, particularly those of a particular performer or composer

examples.text: the factual reliability is commendable—he clearly had a good discography to hand

definitions: all of a performer's or composer's recordings considered as a body of work
shortDefinitions: all of performer's or composer's recordings considered as body of work

definitions: the study of musical recordings and compilation of descriptive catalogs

examples.text: jazz fans direct their intellectual energy to discography

shortDefinitions: study of musical recordings and compilation of descriptive catalogues
